availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Hunt (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Early Hunt and Lucy Ann Hunt. Attended school in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1850. Resident of Rockcastle County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1860. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1863.
[Possibly served in the 11th Kentucky Cav (C.S.A.) but need to check]

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 208B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 537.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 205A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 1, p. 6B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Rockcastle County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 171.
